strings.Value: [Lie] "You're wrong. I haven't found it."
"It's really quite exquisite. I think I'll keep it!"
"Can I see what you have to sell?"
"Packing? Are you leaving us soon?"
"Could I persuade you to stay? I could use someone familiar with magic."
"I regret what I've done. I shouldn't have meddled in your affairs. If you agree to stay, I promise to never do so again."
[Attack] "I no longer require your services."
"It's time I should leave. Farewell."
[Remain silent]
[Leave] "Cut it out, Octavia. Let's go."
"I've an offer for you: stay as one of my advisors. There are so few people who see things in such a critical and rational way."

{n}Bartholomew has managed to clean up the mess after the troll attack in his laboratory. The wizard is packing his items — books, vials, manacles, and needles — carefully wrapping his things in cloth before placing them in crates. He turns as he notices you approach.{/n}
{n}The laboratory feels emptier than before. The wizard is packing his items — books, vials, manacles, and needles — carefully wrapping his things in cloth before placing them in crates.{/n}
{n}Bartholomew hums a simple tune as he unpacks his things, sorting them back into their proper places.{/n}
"Have you brought my whip?!" {n}The wizard snaps at you.{/n} "I can feel it. It is near... Give it to me — now!"

"Oh, Your Grace! Oh, how good to see you alive and well. Let me congratulate you on yet another brilliant victory! Would you perhaps permit me one small request? I sense that you've recovered something of mine..." {n}Bartholomew's voice trembles with excitement.{/n}

"Don't bother me with your explanations or excuses," {n}the wizard snaps at you coldly.{/n} "I'm already well aware that my treasure has been destroyed. Such a senseless waste..." {n}Bartholomew turns away and resumes packing his flasks and vials, his hands trembling.{/n}

"My treasure..." {n}Perplexion cascades down the wizard's face.{/n} "You let it slip through your fingers... I know exactly where it is right now, but it's no use... I'll be chasing it forever..." {n}Bartholomew turns back to his flasks and vials, his hands trembling.{/n}
{n}The wizard's face contorts with anger, but he dares not object. Bartholomew turns away abruptly and resumes packing his flasks and vials, his hands trembling.{/n}
"Certainly."
"Yes, I am," {n}the wizard answers curtly.{/n} "It's far too dangerous to stay here. Besides..." {n}He doesn't finish the thought.{/n} "Never mind. It doesn't matter."
"Yes, Your Grace. It's become too dangerous to stay here, even with your protection. I'll have to find someplace safe and quiet."

{n}Bartholomew's brow wrinkles, and he whispers some calculations under his breath — then smiles.{/n} "I may regret this later, but come what may, I'll stay. You've shown yourself a strong and generous ruler, as well as open-minded. I suppose we may yet be useful to one another."
"I've no doubt of that." {n}Bartholomew sneers.{/n} "But I'm afraid you'll have to find someone else to fulfill your magical needs."

{n}The mage glares at you for a moment, then slowly nods.{/n} "After what you've done, it's hard for me to trust you, {mf|Baron|Baroness} — but I'm willing to give you one more chance. If you promise to keep out of my affairs, I shall stay and serve you. But I won't forget what you've done. You owe me, Your Grace, and some day I'll take my due."
{n}Octavia looks back and forth between you and Bartholomew, glaring.{/n} "Oh, great. This is exactly what we need..."
"Until we meet again, Your Grace! Thank you for all you've done for me!"
"Until we meet again. Perhaps we'll manage to get along after all."
{n}Without turning to face you, Bartholomew mutters something under his breath.{/n}
"Is that how you speak to your {mf|baron|baroness}? Face {mf|him|her} directly and say a proper farewell!"
{n}Bartholomew turns and speaks through clenched teeth.{/n} "Farewell, Your Grace. Safe travels. Godspeed."
"And why is your face so grim? Did you study grimacing at some academy?"
"We saved your life, and you dare turn your back on us? Come now, thank {mf|His|Her} Grace for all {mf|he|she}'s done for you!"
{n}Bartholomew's face turns red. Glaring at Octavia, he raises his hands as if to cast a spell.{/n}

{n}Bartholomew stops packing and looks at you incredulously. Then he looks at the stack of books in his hands and keeps silent for a long time, figuring something out in his mind. Finally, Bartholomew sighs and puts his books aside.{/n} "I cannot refuse such an offer. Of course, Your Grace, I shall enter your service. — After all, it's such a rare opportunity."

{n}He looks around his packed bags and smirks.{/n} "Seems all this packing was unnecessary — I'll not take the laboratory with me. I'd prefer a lighter journey to the capital. As soon as I pack the essentials and lock up the house, I'll head straight for the city. See you there."
